td.content: s:white F aged 44 years presents via EMS a short time following MVA. she was struck while passing through intersection, and sustained injury to the front of the head (LOC 7 min). Striking vehicle traveling at estimated 30 mph on impact. patient c/o severe headache, moderate nausea, mild vomiting and Traumatic Injury - Blunt. o:Height 176 cm, Weight 44 kg, Temperature 37.2 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 16, CT Head (-) WNL w/ no acute findings suggestive of ICB, MRI Brain Unremarkable, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, appears in NAD, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, Chest = normal breathing sounds B/L, Neuro: WNL a:TBI (concussion) p:administered Flexeril - 10 mg po q 8 hrs PRN pain/cramps, performed CT Head, MRI Brain, and performed E/M Emergency Services Level 3 - Completed, and ordered rest, and referred patient to family practice/primary care.

td.content: s:44 yr old white f search engine optimizer returns for f/u one (1) week s/p concussion with LOC 7 min. denies vomiting, nausea and headache. First 24-hour hourly checks were without incident. Alcohol 1-4 beers/month she does not smoke o:Height 177 cm, Weight 44.9 kg, Temperature 37.3 C, Pulse 77, SystolicBP 111, DiastolicBP 72, Respiration 17, ImPACT test Verbal Memory=98,Visual Memory=97,Processing Speed=46.1,Reaction Time=0.47, Abd: Scaphoid, soft, ND, NTTP. BS WNL, MS: Extremities x 4 WNL. Strength 5/5, equal bilaterally, Neuro: CN II-XII WNL. No deficits, Eyes = normal pupillary reflex, HEENT: NCAT, PERRL, Neck: Supple, C/V: RRR, Pulm: CTAB. Good effort a:S/P Concussion (with loss of consciousness of 30 minutes or less). No sequelae p:performed ImPACT test, and performed E/M Level 2 (new patient) - Completed.
